column4: When I try to install Google Gears in FireFox on ubuntu for getting Gmail emails off-line I get this error message ""Google Gears" could not be installed because it is not compatible with your Firefox build type (Linux_x86_64-gcc3). Please contact the author of this item about the problem."
looks like they don't offer a 64-bit version of google gears
So you think the problem is my 64-bit, not linux?
correct, I installed the 32-bit version to test offline gmail support and that does work on ubuntu intrepid
Is there a workaround I can use for 64-bit?
not that i know off sorry, never used anything 64-bit yet
hm, ok thanks anyways
have you seen http://nielspeen.com/blog/2009/02/google-gears-64-bit/ yet ? might do the trick ...
Thanks ill try it out. Right now I just use Evolution for email offline but I just kinda wanted to test it out.
How exactly does it work anyways? If I open up a browser and type in gmail.com it will still work but without any new emails?
Holy crap why is this download 4 gigs?
you'll have to put firefox into offline mode, and as soon it sees a working connection it will upload and sync your mails
4 GB ? dunno, but that sounds strange ...
Maybe I read it wrong or something...but it seems to have downloaded
according to several comments at http://www.techrecipes.net/linux/google-gears-in-64-bit-linux.html despite the error message you first reported, it does seem to work ... confusing indeed :)
Hey thanks so much
very welcome, hope it works for you
Curious as to where the desktop shortcut is added to since its not the desktop lol
you can always try to run the "locate gears" command (after updating the installed files database with "sudo updatedb"
Well that found where the extension is stored and such but how would that help find out where it saves Desktop Shortcuts that I create?
o sorry, misunderstood your question
